How CryptoBubbles Behave

Why They Move Between Effect Windows

üëÅÔ∏è What You're Seeing

You may notice that CryptoBubbles occasionally switch between different effect windows after periodic updates (approximately every 60 seconds).

This is expected behavior. The movement reflects real-time changes in market conditions and is a core feature of our dynamic visualization system.

‚öôÔ∏è Intentional Design

CryptoBubbles is designed to mirror the market dynamically. Each effect window represents a specific market state:

  • Momentum surges and price acceleration
  • Cooling phases and trend reversals
  • Volume behavior and liquidity patterns
  • Volatility transitions and stability zones

With every update cycle, the system recalculates each bubble's market state based on the latest data, ensuring accurate classification at all times.

üîÑ Why Bubbles "Jump" Between Windows

Cryptocurrency markets move fast. A bubble may transition between effect windows due to:

  • Price changes ‚Äì Significant percentage gains or losses
  • Momentum shifts ‚Äì Rapid acceleration or deceleration
  • Volatility changes ‚Äì Increased or decreased price swings
  • Volume spikes or drops ‚Äì Sudden trading activity changes
  • Trend transitions ‚Äì Moving from bullish to bearish (or vice versa)
  • Liquidity changes ‚Äì Order book depth fluctuations

These market-driven triggers can occur within seconds, which is why the UI updates regularly to keep you informed.

Each effect window groups coins that currently share the same market behavior pattern. This allows for faster scanning and more efficient decision-making.

üìä How This Helps You

The dynamic grouping system offers significant advantages:

  • Instant visibility ‚Äì Spot which coins are heating up, cooling down, or stabilizing at a glance
  • Reduced manual work ‚Äì No need to check each coin individually
  • Improved situational awareness ‚Äì Understand market-wide behavior patterns quickly
  • Faster reaction time ‚Äì Identify opportunities or risks as they emerge

The system does the heavy lifting so you can focus on making informed decisions.

‚ùì "Is this a bug?"

No. When Auto Market Mode is active, bubble movement between windows is intentional and expected. Frequent movement indicates a changing market ‚Äì not a broken UI. The system is working exactly as designed to keep you updated with accurate, real-time classifications.

‚è±Ô∏è Update Frequency & Transparency

CryptoBubbles refreshes market data approximately every 60 seconds. Each refresh cycle:

  • Fetches the latest price, volume, and market cap data
  • Re-evaluates all classification rules for every bubble
  • Updates visual effects to reflect current market states

The UI prioritizes accuracy over static placement. We believe showing you the truth is more valuable than showing you a comfortable but outdated picture.

üîÆ Future Enhancements

In future versions, we may introduce options such as:

  • "Lock bubble to window" ‚Äì Keep a specific coin in your preferred view
  • "Stability filters" ‚Äì Reduce movement frequency for calmer visualization
  • "Movement history" ‚Äì Track how a bubble traveled between states

No release date has been set for these features.
